Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch to a 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using a rotation of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 degrees and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.25 units. This will result in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the following dimensions: length = 0.75, width = 0.75, height = 0.25. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Start by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector set to [0.5, 0.0, 0.125]. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Next, draw a 2D sketch on the Y-Z plane of the newly created coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) and a single loop (loop\\_1) with four lines: - line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.25, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point = [0.25, 0.0], End Point = [0.25, 0.125] - line\\_3: Start Point = [0.25, 0.125], End Point = [0.0, 0.125] - line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.125], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch using a scale factor of 0.25. Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch to a 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using a rotation of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 degrees and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 5: Subtract the 3D sketch from the previous part Cut the 3D sketch from the previous rectangular prism (Part 1) along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.125 units. This will result in a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top with the following dimensions: length = 0.25, width = 0.125, height = 0.25.</description>
